request_pathways.name: Request for Access to Health Information by Patient or Personal Representative
Authorization for Release of Health Information (third-party)

access_pathway.primary_pathway_description: Northwell Health provides a dedicated 2-page fillable 'Request for Access to Health Information' form (VD087) explicitly citing HIPAA § 164.524, separate from their general third-party authorization form.

red_flags: No submission instructions provided on any form or instruction document — patients cannot determine where to send the completed form
No cross-reference between the third-party release form and the patient access form — patients may complete the wrong form
bright_spots: Dedicated patient access form distinct from third-party authorization — explicitly cites HIPAA 45 CFR § 164.524
28 fillable PDF fields enabling fully digital form completion
Companion instruction documents with annotated visual examples for both forms
Comprehensive delivery format options including USB flash drive, CD, secure email, unsecure email with informed consent, fax, mail, and pickup

findability.rationale: Level 4: Forms are directly linked from the Northwell Health medical records page and found with a simple web search, though patients must navigate to the parent system site rather than the facility's own website.

technical_accessibility.rationale: Level 4: The patient access form has 28 fillable fields enabling digital completion, but submission method is unspecified in all documents, leaving one gap in the digital workflow.

content_design.rationale: Level 4: Well-organized 2-page form with numbered sections, logical flow, plain language, and companion instructions; minor issues include ambiguous witness line and moderately complex delivery matrix.

patient_centeredness.rationale: Level 5: Dedicated patient self-access form explicitly citing HIPAA § 164.524, clearly distinct from the third-party release form, with 'To me' as the first recipient option and comprehensive delivery format choices.

compliance.rationale: Level 4: No notarization, no in-person requirement, appropriate handling of SUD/HIV consent under 42 CFR Part 2; minor ambiguities around witness requirement and absence of fee disclosure.

overall.summary: Northwell Health provides an above-average patient access experience through a dedicated fillable patient access form with HIPAA citation, companion instructions, and comprehensive delivery options, with gaps in submission instructions and cross-referencing between forms.
